hint.text:
Total interior angle of a polygon is
\((n-2)\times 180\)

solution.text:
Consider the smallest angle _{{(((n-2)*180)/n)-(((n-1)*p)/2)}}_\(^o\) as first term (\(a_1\)) and the difference between two consecutive interior angles \(_{p}_ ^o\) as common difference (\(d\)) of an A.P. .
Let \(n\) = number of sides.
then
Equate total interior angle formula of a polygon with total sum of the A.P.
i.e.
\((n-2)\times 180= \frac{n}{2}\times(2a_1+(n-1)d)\)
Solving this equation you will get
\(n=_{n}_\).

content.text: The difference between any two consecutive interior angles of a polygon is \(_{p}_ ^o\). If the smallest angle is _{{(((n-2)*180)/n)-(((n-1)*p)/2)}}_\(^o\) find the number of sides of the polygon.
